SENT.plain: Nevus flammeus (cutaneous hemangioma, port-wine stain) may develop proliferative hamartomatous changes and go on to form monstrous deforming tumors
Excision is feasible, and it may be best to do it early
The mentally retarded, institutionalized patient can also benefit from the reconstruction
In 3 cases it was possible to preserve function of the muscles of facial expression, because of the superficial location of the tumor
Techniques to decrease blood loss are of variable value during the operative procedure
